title: Dolgoch Falls Walking Route

images.title: Dolgoch Falls hotel and car park by Gareth James, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dolgoch Falls hotel and car park

images.title: hayley green / The way to the falls, Dolgoch
images.caption: The way to the falls. The track from the station to the falls crosses this land on an elevated wooden walkway. Reminded me of the Bradbury short story 'The Sound of Thunder' so was very careful not to step off the path or tread on any butterflies.

images.title: OLU, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dolgoch Falls viaduct. A Talyllyn Railway train from Tywyn crosses the viaduct.

images.title: Downstream from Dolgoch Falls by John Firth, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Downstream from the falls.

images.title: rob bishop / View from above  Dolgoch Falls
images.caption: Hills and countryside view from above the falls

images.title: hayley green / Path back to Dolgoch station, from the falls
images.caption: Path back to Dolgoch station, from the falls

images.title: E Gammie / Bluebell woods, Dolgoch
images.caption: Bluebell woods. Deciduous woodland and bluebells in Nant Dol-gôch valley.

description: Travel on the marvellous Talyllyn Railway to Dolgoch and visit the beautiful Dolgoch Falls on this circular walk in the Snowdonia National Park. You can pick up the steam operated railway from the seaside town of Tywyn on the Cardigan Bay coast. It will then take you on a lovely journey through the Fathew valley to Dolgoch where a short walk will take you to the falls. There are footpaths taking you to the three levels of the falls which are spectacular in wet weather. Some of the paths are quite steep and can get a bit wet so a reasonable level of fitness and a good pair of walking shoes is advisable if you are going to do the whole trail. If you'd like to continue your walking in the area you can enjoy waymarked woodland walks in the Nant Gwernol ravine. Alight at Nant Gwernol station to enjoy these walks.
